    • fill

      public static String fill(String text, int count)
      Fills out a new String with the text repeated count times.
      Implementation Note:
      Uses text.repeat(count) to fill out String.
      Parameters:
      text - to repeat
      count - number of repeats
      Returns:
      new String
      See Also:
      • String.repeat(int)

    • lTrim

      public static String lTrim(String text)
      Trim all whitespace characters from the beginning of the text string.
      Parameters:
      text - to trim
      Returns:
      new String if trimmed, original String if no trimming needed, or null if 'text' is null..
      See Also:
      • Character.isWhitespace(char)

    • leftJustify

      public static String leftJustify(int number, int width)
      Formats the number to be left justified within a text string of width length.

      Appends spaces to the right of the 'number' so the final String is 'width' long.

      Parameters:
      number - to wrap
      width - of required text
      Returns:
      the formatted text

    • leftJustify

      public static String leftJustify(String text, int width)
      Formats the text to be left justified within a text string of width length.

      Appends spaces to the right of the 'text' so the final String is 'width' long.

      Parameters:
      text - to wrap
      width - of required text
      Returns:
      the formatted text

    • rTrim

      public static String rTrim(String text)
      Trim all whitespace characters from the end of the text string.
      Parameters:
      text - to trim
      Returns:
      new String if trimmed, original String if no trimming needed, or null if 'text' is null..
      See Also:
      • Character.isWhitespace(char)

    • requireNonBlank

      public static String requireNonBlank(String str)
      Checks that the specified string isn't blank.
      blank:
      The string is either empty or contains only white space code-points.
      empty:
      The string's length is 0.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to check for blankness.
      Returns:
      str if not blank.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if str is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if str is blank.
      See Also:
      • requireNonEmpty(java.lang.String)

    • requireNonBlank

      public static String requireNonBlank(String str, String message)
      Checks that the specified string isn't blank.
      blank:
      The string is either empty or contains only white space code-points.
      empty:
      The string's length is 0.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to check for blankness.
      message - Detail message to be used in the event that an exception is thrown.
      Returns:
      str if not blank.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if str is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if str is blank.
      See Also:
      • requireNonEmpty(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

    • requireNonEmpty

      public static String requireNonEmpty(String str)
      Checks that the specified string isn't empty.
      empty:
      The string's length is 0.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to check for emptiness.
      Returns:
      str if not empty.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if str is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if str is empty.

    • requireNonEmpty

      public static String requireNonEmpty(String str, String message)
      Checks that the specified string isn't empty.
      empty:
      The string's length is 0.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to check for emptiness.
      message - Detail message to be used in the event that an exception is thrown.
      Returns:
      str if not empty.
